item.value: English is the second most spoken language in the world.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high. On May 29 1953 Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay were the first to reach the peak.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
The Sun's outer layer has a temperature of 6,000C . Inside the sun the temperature is 15,000,000 C.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system.
The elephant is distinguished by its high level of intelligence, interesting behavior, methods of communication and complex social structure.
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
Yuma in the state of Arizona has over 4,000 hours of sunshine per year - making it the sunniest place on the planet. The South Pole is the least sunny place with only 182 days a year off sunshine
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.

On 12 April 1961 Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin, a Soviet cosmonaut , became the first human in outer space and the first to orbit the Earth. He became a hero of the Soviet Union for his pioneering tour in space.
More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
The earliest dated printed book is the "Diamond Sutra", printed in China almost 3,000 thousand years ago.
The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
In 1932 Amelia Earhart became the first woman to do a solo transatlantic flight. She flew from Harbor Grace, Newfoundland, to Ireland in approximately 15 hr.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It is about 38 million kilometers away. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is only 4.6 billion years old.
The launch of the Russian Spiknit 1 spcecraft started the 'space race' between Russia and America. Explorer 1 was the first spacecraft launched by the United States on 31 January 1958.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world. There are also more than 7,000 dialects. A dialect is a regional language variation with different pronunciation, vocabulary, or meaning.
